pageContext.claim: “Human trafficking can go down by a tremendous percentage if we had a wall on our southern border. Tremendous.”
pageContext.analysis: There is no evidence that human trafficking into the United States would "go down by a tremendous percentage" if there was a wall on the southern border. There are no specific statistics to show how victims of sex trafficking enter the United States, though experts say many are coerced to enter the country under false pretenses through legal ports of entry such as airports.
